item.title: 阿托斯称收到四份重组提议
item.description: 濒临破产的法国 IT 公司 Atos 周一证实，该公司已收到来自投资者的四份不同的债务重组和现金注入要约。【原文：Ailing French IT company Atos on Monday confirmed it had received four distinct offers from investors to restructure its debt and inject cash into the business.】

item.title: 中国关税可能导致干邑生产商白兰地过剩
item.description: 根据路透社的计算，中国对欧盟白兰地征收高额关税将使法国公司大量白兰地难以在其他地方销售，分析师和投资者担心公司可能被迫打折。【原文：High Chinese tariffs on EU brandy would leave French companies with vast amounts of cognac that could be hard to sell elsewhere, according to Reuters' calculations, analysts, and investors who fear firms could be forced to discount.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，瑞士信贷最后一任首席执行官乌尔里希-科纳将离开瑞银集团
item.description: 据英国《金融时报》周一报道，瑞士信贷集团（Credit Suisse）最后一任首席执行官乌尔里希-科纳（Ulrich Korner）将在未来几周内离开瑞银集团。【原文：Ulrich Korner, the final CEO of Credit Suisse, is set to leave UBS in the coming weeks, the Financial Times reported on Monday.】

item.title: 加拿大西捷航空公司与工会达成避免停工的临时协议
item.description: 加拿大西捷航空集团（WestJet Group）周一在一份联合声明中说，该集团已与代表其维修工程师的工会达成了避免停工的临时协议。【原文：Canadian airline WestJet Group has reached a tentative agreement with the union representing its maintenance engineers to avert work stoppage, the two parties said in a joint statement on Monday.】

item.title: 早间竞标：重回降息轨道
item.description: Rae Wee 对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Rae Wee】

item.title: 印尼第一季度国内生产总值（GDP）增长超出预期，创 3 个季度以来最高水平
item.description: 印尼统计局周一公布的数据显示，印尼第一季度经济同比增长5.11%，创下三个季度以来的最高增速，且快于预期。【原文：Indonesia's economy grew by 5.11% in the first quarter from a year earlier, the highest in three quarters and faster than expected, data from the statistics bureau showed on Monday.】

item.title: 首席经济学家莱恩：欧洲央行降息理由越来越充分
item.description: 欧洲央行首席经济学家菲利普-莱恩（Philip Lane）周一告诉西班牙报纸《El Confidencial》，随着服务业通胀终于开始缓解，欧洲央行 6 月份降息的理由越来越充分。【原文：The case for a European Central Bank interest rate cut in June is getting stronger as services inflation is finally starting to ease, ECB Chief Economist Philip Lane told Spanish newspaper El Confidencial on Monday.】

item.title: 中国和美国电动汽车的增长将导致今年汽油需求增长放缓
item.description: 分析师称，受中国和美国转向电动汽车以及去年 COVID-19 之后消费恢复正常的影响，2024 年全球汽油需求增长可能减半，从而挤压炼油厂下半年的利润。【原文：Global petrol demand growth could halve in 2024, squeezing second-half refinery margins, analysts said, driven by a shift to electric cars in China and the United States and a return to normal consumption after last year's bounce following COVID-19.】

item.title: 亚洲股市因美联储减息押注而反弹；日元缩减涨幅
item.description: 亚洲股市周一上涨，原因是市场再次押注美联储可能在今年放宽利率，而日元在上周因东京疑似货币干预而大幅飙升后走软。【原文：Asian stocks rose on Monday on renewed bets that the Federal Reserve would likely ease rates this year, while the yen weakened after a strong surge last week from Tokyo's suspected currency intervention.】

item.title: 财新服务业采购经理人指数显示，中国 4 月服务业活动有所放缓，但依然稳健
item.description: 周一的一项私营企业调查显示，由于成本上升，中国服务业活动的扩张略有放缓，但新订单增长加快，商业景气稳健上升，从而提振了经济持续复苏的希望。【原文：China's services activity expansion slowed a touch amid rising costs, but growth in new orders accelerated and business sentiment rose solidly in a boost to hopes of a sustained economic recovery, a private sector survey showed on Monday.】

item.title: 沙特阿拉伯提高石油价格后，石油价格微幅走高
item.description: 沙特阿拉伯上调了大部分地区的 6 月原油价格，加沙停火协议的前景似乎渺茫，这再次引发了人们对以色列-哈马斯冲突仍可能在这一重要产油区扩大的担忧，石油期货周一上扬。【原文：Oil futures edged up on Monday after Saudi Arabia hiked June crude prices for most regions and as the prospect of a Gaza ceasefire deal appeared slim, renewing fears the Israel-Hamas conflict could still widen in the key oil producing region.】

item.title: 美国就业报告疲软，美元持稳；日元本周开局不利
item.description: 周一，美元大体持稳，因为一份疲软的美国就业报告推高了美联储今年仍可能降息两次的赌注，而日元在本周伊始略微走弱。【原文：The dollar was broadly steady on Monday as a soft U.S. jobs report boosted wagers that the Federal Reserve may still cut rates twice this year, while the yen was a tad weaker to start the week.】

item.title: 澳航因航班取消面临 6600 万美元罚款
item.description: 澳大利亚旗舰航空公司澳洲航空公司（Qantas Airways）周一表示，该公司与该国竞争监管机构达成了一项和解协议，根据该协议，该公司可能有义务就航班取消案支付 1 亿澳元（6606 万美元）的民事罚款。【原文：Australian flagship airline Qantas Airways said on Monday it reached a settlement agreement with the country's competition regulator under which it may be obliged to pay A$100 million ($66.06 million) civil penalty in a flight cancellation case.】

item.title: 早间竞标：金融环境亮起绿灯，外汇市场风平浪静
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 澳大利亚西太平洋银行净利润下降 16%，宣布额外回购 6.61 亿澳元
item.description: 澳大利亚西太平洋银行（Westpac Banking Corp）周一公布的上半年净利润下降了 16%，原因是激烈的贷款竞争和成本上升挤压了利润空间。该公司还宣布将现有的股票回购计划增加 10 亿澳元。【原文：Australia's Westpac Banking Corp reported a 16% drop in its first-half net profit on Monday as margins are squeezed by intense lending competition and higher costs. It also announced an increase of A$1 billion to an existing share buyback program.】

item.title: 据报道，阿托斯董事会将于周日召开会议，审查收购要约
item.description: 据《回声报》和《费加罗报》报道，法国科技公司阿托斯董事会将于周日晚间召开会议，审议收购要约，其中包括捷克商人丹尼尔-克雷廷斯基（Daniel Kretinsky）提出的收购要约。【原文：The board of French tech firm Atos was due to meet on Sunday evening to consider takeover offers, including one submitted by Czech businessman Daniel Kretinsky, Les Echos and Le Figaro reported.】

item.title: 大型石油公司在深水勘探领域发现更多惊喜
item.description: 本周，大型石油公司将重返休斯顿，参加该行业一年一度的海上能源项目和设备展示会，圭亚那、纳米比亚和美国墨西哥湾沿岸的深水发现将成为焦点。【原文：As Big Oil returns this week to the industry's annual showcase for offshore energy projects and equipment in Houston, deepwater discoveries off Guyana, Namibia and the U.S. Gulf Coast will take the spotlight.】

item.title: 全球经济放缓意味着澳大利亚预算收入增幅减小
item.description: 澳大利亚政府周日表示，全球经济疲软和国内经济放缓是澳大利亚截至 6 月 30 日的联邦预算收入增幅低于近几年的原因之一。【原文：Global economic weakness and a slowing domestic economy were among the reasons Australia will report a smaller revenue increase in its federal budget for the year ended June 30 compared to recent years, the government said on Sunday.】

item.title: 伯克希尔的布鲁克斯跑步公司首席执行官将中国和欧洲视为增长点
item.description: Brooks Running 新任首席执行官表示，这家由沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）控股的跑鞋制造商将中国和欧洲视为其业务的增长点，而该公司的大部分收入都来自美国。【原文：The new chief executive of Brooks Running said the running shoe maker owned by Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway views China and Europe as growth areas for a business that generates most revenue in the U.S.】

item.title: 富士康重申第二季度营收将增长，4 月份销售额创历史新高
item.description: 台湾富士康是全球最大的合约电子制造商和苹果 iPhone 的最大组装商，该公司周日重申，预计第二季度收入将增长，并公布了 4 月份创纪录的销售额。 富士康在一份声明中说，今年第二季度 "仍是传统的淡旺季，主要产品正进入新旧交替期"。【原文：Taiwan's Foxconn, the world's largest contract electronics maker and the biggest assembler of Apple's iPhone, reiterated on Sunday it expected a rise in second-quarter revenue, and reported record sales for the month of April. Foxconn said in a statement that this year's second quarter "remains a traditional off-peak season, and major products are entering a period of transition between old and ne】

item.title: 美国汽车工人联合会批准与戴姆勒卡车公司的合同
item.description: 美国汽车工人联合会（United Auto Workers）成员周六批准了与戴姆勒卡车公司（Daimler Truck）签订的新劳动合同，该工会在一份声明中说。【原文：Members of the United Auto Workers on Saturday ratified a new labor contract with Daimler Truck , the union said in a statement.】

item.title: 派拉蒙竞标者等待评估方案特别委员会的消息
item.description: 派拉蒙全球董事会负责评估公司收购报价的特别委员会于周六上午举行了会议，但该制片厂的竞争对手仍在等待下一步行动的消息。【原文：A special committee of the Paramount Global board charged with evaluating offers for the company met Saturday morning, though rival bidders for the studio are awaiting word on next steps.】

item.title: 伯克希尔股东否决气候、多元化和中国提案
item.description: 伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway Inc）的股东们周六以压倒性多数否决了沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）企业集团针对环境和社会政策问题提出的六项提案，所有这些提案都遭到了这位亿万富翁及其董事会的反对。【原文：Berkshire Hathaway Inc shareholders on Saturday overwhelmingly rejected six proposals addressing environmental and social policy issues at Warren Buffett's conglomerate, all of which the billionaire investor and his board opposed.】

item.title: 沃伦-巴菲特称伯克希尔亏本出售派拉蒙股份
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）周六表示，伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）在亏损的情况下出售了其在派拉蒙公司的全部持股，他说这是他一个人的决定。【原文：Warren Buffett said on Saturday Berkshire Hathaway sold its entire holding in Paramount at a loss, a decision he said was his sole responsibility.】

item.title: 据彭博新闻社报道，中国平安投票反对续聘汇丰首席执行官为董事
item.description: 据彭博新闻社周六报道，汇丰控股公司最大的亚洲投资者--中国平安保险集团股份有限公司在该行股东大会上投票反对续聘离任首席执行官诺埃尔-奎恩（Noel Quinn）为董事。【原文：HSBC Holdings Plc's biggest Asian investor, China's Ping An Insurance Group Co, voted against the reappointment of departing chief executive Noel Quinn as a director at the bank's shareholder meeting, Bloomberg News reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 沃伦-巴菲特称可能增加税收以抵消美国不断扩大的赤字
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）表示，他预计美国政府将增加税收以解决不断扩大的财政赤字问题，而不是减少支出。【原文：Warren Buffett said he expects the U.S. government to increase taxes to tackle widening fiscal deficits rather than reduce spending.】

item.title: 西航向其技术运营工会 AMFA 发出 72 小时停工通知
item.description: Onex Corp 旗下的 WestJet 航空公司周六表示，已向其技术操作工会‍飞机机械师兄弟会（AMFA）发出 72 小时停工通知。【原文：Onex Corp's WestJet on Saturday said that it has issued a 72-hour lockout notification to its technical operations union ‍Aircraft Mechanics Fraternal Association (AMFA).】

item.title: 巴菲特在年会上谈接班人和伯克希尔的未来
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特周六在伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）的年度会议上发表讲话，向他的长期商业伙伴查理-芒格致敬，概述了被指定最终接替他的高管扩大后的角色，并讨论了伯克希尔公司的机遇。【原文：Warren Buffett took the stage at Berkshire Hathaway's annual meeting on Saturday, paying tribute to his longtime business partner Charlie Munger, outlining the expanded roles of the executives who are designated to eventually succeed him and discussing Berkshire's opportunities.】

item.title: 伯克希尔公司高管称针对公用事业公司的野火索赔 "毫无根据
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）领导的企业集团伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway）的一位高管周六表示，该公司将抗击因野火而对其公用事业业务提起的所有诉讼，因为这些案件 "毫无根据"。【原文：Berkshire Hathaway , the conglomerate led by Warren Buffett, will fight all lawsuits brought against its utility business due to wildfires as the cases are "unfounded," a top executive said on Saturday.】

item.title: 伯克希尔利润创历史新高，现金增至 1,890 亿美元，但苹果股份减少
item.description: 伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway Inc）周六公布了创纪录的季度利润，这主要得益于其保险业务的强劲表现。【原文：Berkshire Hathaway Inc posted a record quarterly profit on Saturday, boosted by strength in its insurance operations, and appears to have sold a significant number of Apple shares as its cash stake swelled to $189 billion.】
